title: Implement Plan Phase - Decomposition + Ship It
description: Wire up the Plan phase: AI-assisted feature decomposition from PRD, Plan markdown generation, beads epic/gate task creation, dependency graph visualization, Ship It! button that closes gate tasks. See PRD Section 7.2.
close_reason: Implemented Plan Phase: AI decomposition, Plan markdown, beads epic/gate, dependency graph visualization, Ship It! and Re-ship buttons

title: Agent Failure Recovery and Work Preservation
description: When an agent is externally terminated (SIGTERM/exit 143), all uncommitted work is lost, the task is left orphaned as IN_PROGRESS, and downstream tasks can bypass dependency gates. This epic covers: WIP commit on termination, incremental commit instructions in prompts, orphaned task recovery, dependency gate hardening, failed session diff archival, and agent heartbeat monitoring. See opensprint.dev-ax8.2 incident for context.

title: Fix undefined crash in TaskService.extractEpicId when viewing live agent output
description: When subscribing to live agent output for a task in the Build phase (e.g. opensprint.dev-dlp), the server throws: . The error occurs in TaskService.extractEpicId at line 102, which is called from beadsIssueToTask when converting a beads issue to a Task. The root cause is that  can be undefined when passed to extractEpicId, but the function calls  without a null/undefined check. Add a guard in extractEpicId to handle undefined/null id (e.g. return null early), and optionally add defensive handling in beadsIssueToTask when issue.id is missing.
close_reason: Fixed extractEpicId guard and beadsIssueToTask defensive handling

close_reason: Implemented login endpoint: POST /api/v1/auth/login with JWT, bcrypt validation, auth config at ~/.opensprint/auth.json

title: Consolidate duplicate getEpicId and dependency-edge logic in plan.service.ts
description:
In `plan.service.ts`:

1. **`getEpicId` helper defined twice** (lines 114 and 213) — identical implementations that extract the epic prefix from a hierarchical bead ID.

2. **`buildDependencyEdges` and `buildDependencyEdgesFromProject`** have overlapping logic for constructing dependency graph edges between plans.

Fix:
- Extract `getEpicId` as a top-level utility (or add it to BeadsService since it's bead-ID logic)
- Review the two dependency-edge builders and consolidate where possible
- Consider moving `getEpicId` to the shared package since it's a general bead ID utility

title: Add ESLint and Prettier configuration
description:
Both backend and frontend have \`lint\` scripts in package.json (\`eslint src/\`) but no ESLint configuration files exist anywhere in the project. Running \`npm run lint\` will fail.

No Prettier configuration exists either.

Fix:
1. Add ESLint flat config at root (eslint.config.js) with:
   - TypeScript support (@typescript-eslint)
   - React rules for frontend (eslint-plugin-react, eslint-plugin-react-hooks)
   - Node.js rules for backend
   - Shared base config for both packages

2. Add Prettier config (.prettierrc) at root with consistent formatting rules

3. Add required dev dependencies:
   - eslint, @typescript-eslint/parser, @typescript-eslint/eslint-plugin
   - eslint-plugin-react, eslint-plugin-react-hooks (frontend)
   - prettier, eslint-config-prettier

4. Add format scripts to package.json files

5. Consider adding a pre-commit hook (husky + lint-staged) to enforce formatting

title: Extract shared writeJson utility from 3 services
Extract getPlanContentForTask to ContextAssembler
Extract duplicated frontend utilities (formatSectionKey, formatTimestamp, PRD helpers)
description:
Several utility functions are duplicated in the frontend:

1. `formatSectionKey()` — duplicated in `DreamPhase.tsx` (line 65) and `DesignPhase.tsx` (line 25). Converts snake_case to Title Case.

2. `formatTimestamp()` — duplicated in `DreamPhase.tsx` (line 72) and `DesignPhase.tsx` (line 32). Relative time formatting ("5m ago", "2h ago").

3. `parsePrdSections()` — duplicated in `DesignPhase.tsx` (line 63) and `dreamSlice.ts` (line 36).

4. `PRD_SECTION_ORDER` constant — duplicated in `DreamPhase.tsx` and `DesignPhase.tsx`.

5. Status/category color mappings — duplicated across multiple components.

Fix: Create `packages/frontend/src/lib/prdUtils.ts` with all PRD-related helpers, and `packages/frontend/src/lib/formatting.ts` for generic formatting utilities. Extract shared constants to `packages/frontend/src/lib/constants.ts`.

Also note: `DesignPhase.tsx` appears to be unused/legacy code (not imported in any route). Verify and remove if confirmed unused.

title: Improve frontend API client type safety
description:
The frontend API client (`packages/frontend/src/api/client.ts`, 207 lines) uses `unknown` return types extensively:

```typescript
get: (id: string) => request<unknown>(\`/projects/\${id}\`)
```

This forces consumers to use type assertions (`as Project`) throughout the codebase, losing compile-time safety.

Fix:
- Replace all `unknown` generics with proper types from `@opensprint/shared` (e.g., `request<Project>`, `request<Plan[]>`)
- Remove corresponding `as` casts in consumers
- Consider adding Zod runtime validation for critical API responses
- Also address inconsistent null handling (mix of `| null` and optional properties)

title: Standardize backend error handling on AppError
description:
Error handling is inconsistent across the backend:

1. **Mixed error types**: Some services use `AppError`, others throw generic `Error`. For example, `agent-client.ts` throws generic errors.

2. **Silent failures**: Some catch blocks swallow errors (e.g., `plan.service.ts` line 175).

3. **Error codes**: Some are descriptive (`PROJECT_NOT_FOUND`), others generic (`INTERNAL_ERROR`). No centralized enum/constants for error codes.

4. **Missing context**: Some errors lack details for debugging.

Fix:
- Audit all `throw new Error(...)` and convert to `throw new AppError(...)` where appropriate
- Create an error codes constants file: `packages/backend/src/middleware/error-codes.ts`
- Review catch blocks that swallow errors — add logging at minimum
- Ensure all user-facing errors go through AppError for consistent API responses
- Add error context/details parameter for debugging in non-production environments

Files to review: `agent-client.ts`, `plan.service.ts`, `orchestrator.service.ts`, `concurrent-orchestrator.ts`, `beads.service.ts`

title: Add test coverage for orchestrator services
description:
The two most complex backend services have zero test coverage:

1. **`orchestrator.service.ts`** (347 lines) — Single-agent build orchestrator with state machine (coding → test → review → merge), crash recovery, progressive backoff, watchdog timer, and task lifecycle management.

2. **`concurrent-orchestrator.ts`** (317 lines) — Multi-agent concurrent orchestrator v2.0 with slot management, parallel task assignment, and inactivity monitoring.

Other untested services:
- `deployment-service.ts` — Deployment logic (Expo EAS, custom commands)
- `chat.service.ts` — Complex PRD sync logic
- `test-runner.ts` — Test execution and result parsing

Priority: Focus on orchestrator services first since they contain the most complex business logic and state management. Tests should cover:
- State transitions (idle → coding → review → done/failed)
- Crash recovery behavior
- Progressive backoff and task blocking
- Concurrent slot assignment and limits
- Watchdog/inactivity timeout handling

Note: These services have many dependencies (BeadsService, BranchManager, AgentService, etc.) that will need mocking.

title: Split large components: DreamPhase, ProjectSetup, BuildPhase
description:
Several frontend components exceed 500 lines and should be decomposed:

1. **`DreamPhase.tsx`** (897 lines) — Contains PRD viewer, inline editing, chat panel, file upload, section navigation, and change log display all in one component. Also has 5+ inline SVG icon components.

   Split into:
   - `PrdViewer` — Section display and inline editing
   - `PrdChatPanel` — Chat interface for PRD generation
   - `PrdUploadButton` — File upload logic
   - `PrdChangeLog` — Change history display
   - Move SVG icons to `components/icons/` or use a library

2. **`ProjectSetup.tsx`** (681 lines) — Multi-step wizard with all steps inline.

   Split into: Extract remaining wizard steps into `components/ProjectSetupWizard/` (some steps are already extracted, like `ProjectMetadataStep`).

3. **`BuildPhase.tsx`** (526 lines) — Kanban board with task cards, column rendering, and status management all inline.

   Split into:
   - `KanbanBoard` — Board layout and columns
   - `KanbanCard` — Individual task card
   - `TaskStatusBadge` — Status color/label component

title: Add frontend test coverage for complex components and Redux slices
description:
Frontend test coverage is estimated at ~10-15%. Current tests (8 files, 47 tests) cover mostly utility functions and basic renders. The AgentDashboard tests also emit act() warnings.

Missing coverage for:
- **Complex page components**: DreamPhase, BuildPhase (no tests at all)
- **Redux slices**: dreamSlice, planSlice, buildSlice, verifySlice, websocketSlice — no unit tests for reducers/actions
- **Custom hooks**: useWebSocket, useProject — no tests
- **API client**: No tests for request handling, error cases, or type mapping

Priority areas:
1. Redux slice unit tests (pure functions, easy to test, high value)
2. Fix existing AgentDashboard tests to wrap state updates in act()
3. Add hook tests using @testing-library/react renderHook
4. Add frontend vitest coverage configuration (backend has it, frontend doesn't)

Dispatch fetchTaskDetail, startBuild, pauseBuild, markTaskComplete thunks. Agent output and build status come from Redux (populated by WS middleware). Keep local state for UI-only concerns.

title: WIP commit on SIGTERM — preserve agent work on termination
description: When an agent process is terminated (SIGTERM, inactivity timeout, or external kill), any uncommitted work is lost. Fix: (1) In run-agent-task.ts, the SIGTERM handler should git add -A && git commit with a WIP message before exiting. (2) In orchestrator.service.ts, before calling state.activeProcess.kill() on inactivity timeout, commit any uncommitted changes on the task branch via branchManager. (3) Add a branchManager.commitWip(repoPath, taskId) helper that checks for uncommitted changes and creates a WIP commit if any exist. This ensures partial work survives agent termination and can be picked up by retries.
close_reason: Implementation meets all acceptance criteria. (1) run-agent-task.ts SIGTERM handler calls branchManager.commitWip before exiting; (2) orchestrator.service.ts inactivity timeout handlers call commitWip before kill in both coding and review phases; (3) branchManager.commitWip checks for uncommitted changes and creates WIP commit if any exist. Tests cover commitWip (no changes, new file, modified file, error handling, task branch, SIGTERM scenario). Code quality is good with reasonable error handling.

title: Orphaned task recovery — detect and retry abandoned IN_PROGRESS tasks
description: When an agent is killed, its task remains IN_PROGRESS with no active process. Add recovery logic: (1) On orchestrator startup (startBuild), scan for tasks that are in_progress with an agent assignee but have no active process — these are orphaned. (2) For each orphaned task, check the task branch for uncommitted changes and commit them as WIP. (3) Reset the task status to open (bd update --status open) so it re-enters the ready queue for retry. (4) In agent-chain.sh, add a similar pre-flight check: before picking a new task, look for in_progress tasks assigned to agents and reset them. (5) Log a warning when recovering orphaned tasks for observability.

title: Agent heartbeat mechanism for stale process detection
description: Add a heartbeat mechanism so the orchestrator can distinguish between a slow agent and a dead one. (1) During agent execution, write a heartbeat file to .opensprint/active/<task-id>/heartbeat.json every 10 seconds containing {pid, lastOutputTimestamp, heartbeatTimestamp}. (2) On orchestrator startup, check for stale heartbeat files (timestamp > 2 minutes old) to identify orphaned tasks — complements the orphaned task recovery issue. (3) The inactivity timer in orchestrator.service.ts should check the heartbeat file as a secondary signal: if the process is dead (pid check) but the timer hasn't fired yet, recover immediately rather than waiting for the full timeout. (4) Clean up heartbeat files when archiving sessions.

title: Refactor PlanPhase to use Redux
description: Replace useState + useWebSocket in PlanPhase.tsx with useAppSelector and useAppDispatch from planSlice. Remove direct useWebSocket import. Keep chatInput, showAddPlanModal as local state. Dispatch decomposePlans, shipPlan, reshipPlan, sendPlanMessage thunks instead of inline API calls.

title: Create Redux slice — build
description: Create buildSlice with async thunks: fetchTasks, fetchBuildPlans, fetchBuildStatus, fetchTaskDetail, fetchArchivedSessions, startBuild, pauseBuild, markTaskComplete. WS-driven reducers: appendAgentOutput, setOrchestratorRunning, setAwaitingApproval, setCompletionState, taskUpdated. State: tasks, plans, orchestratorRunning, awaitingApproval, selectedTaskId, taskDetail, agentOutput, completionState, archivedSessions, loading, error.

title: Fix bd ready dependency gate — treat in_progress blockers as unresolved
description: bd ready currently returns tasks whose blockers are in_progress (not open), treating them as resolved. This allowed opensprint.dev-ax8.3 to start while its blocker ax8.2 was still IN_PROGRESS, causing duplicate work. Fix: bd ready should only consider a blocks dependency resolved when the blocker status is closed. As an immediate mitigation, add a pre-flight check in orchestrator.service.ts runLoop() that verifies all blocks dependencies are closed before claiming a task. Both the orchestrator guard and the agent-chain.sh script need this check.
close_reason: Fixed: BeadsService.ready() filters unclosed blockers, orchestrators run pre-flight check, agent-chain.sh uses check-blockers-closed CLI script. Tests added.

title: Show error on failed login
close_reason: Implemented error display on failed login: Login page shows error message when credentials are invalid

title: Instruct agents to commit incrementally in prompt template
description: The current prompt template in run-agent-task.ts and context-assembler.ts tells agents to commit once at the end. Change the prompt to instruct agents to commit after each logical unit of work (e.g. 'Commit after each meaningful change with descriptive WIP messages. Do not wait until the end to commit.'). This is a zero-code-risk change that dramatically reduces work loss when agents are terminated. Update both the CLI prompt (run-agent-task.ts chain instructions) and the orchestrator prompt template (context-assembler.ts).

title: Archive git diff on agent failure — capture partial work for retry context
description: When an agent fails (non-zero exit, timeout, SIGTERM), the session is archived with gitDiff: null, losing context about what the agent accomplished. Fix: In orchestrator.service.ts handleTaskFailure() and handleCodingComplete() failure path, capture the branch diff (git diff main..branch) and any uncommitted changes (git diff) before archiving the session. Combine them into the session's gitDiff field. This gives subsequent retry attempts full context of prior work via the dependency output collection pipeline.

title: Active agents registry - show all running agents across Design, Plan, Build, Validate
description: Implement a unified view of all agents currently running across Design, Plan, Build, and Validate phases. Currently only Build orchestrator tracks agents; Design/Plan/Validate use fire-and-forget invoke() with no central registry. Epic covers: ActiveAgentsService, instrumentation of all phases, API endpoint, WebSocket events, and UI component.

title: Fix real-time state update when feedback agent completes
description: When submitting feedback, the server logs indicate the agent completed successfully, but the frontend does not update the state from 'pending' to 'mapped' until the page is refreshed. This suggests a bug with websocket handling—either the client is not receiving the completion event, not processing it correctly, or the state update is not being triggered. The fix should ensure the frontend reflects the server state in real-time without requiring a manual refresh.
close_reason: Fix real-time state update: refetch feedback list on feedback.mapped; broadcast in all status→mapped code paths
